comment.author: 89062420@N02
comment._content:
First Name: John   
Surname: Aitken   
Birth Town:  Dundee, Forfarshire   
Resided Town: Wormit, Fifeshire   
Nationality: British   
Date of Death: 30/07/1916   
Fate: Killed in Action   
Parent: John Aitken, of ""Roseneath,"" Wormit, Fife.   
Rank: Private   
Service Number: 30816   
Duty Location: France And Flanders 
Awarded: Victory Medal, British War Medal.
Regiment/Service: Royal Scots 2nd Bn. 
Grave Reference: XXII. D. 5.
Cemetery: DELVILLE WOOD CEMETERY, LONGUEVAL

comment.author: 16074369@N07
comment._content: Also on the Wormit war memorial. warmemscot.s4.bizhat.com/viewtopic.php?p=58579

comment.author: 78785369@N06
comment._content:
2nd Battalion Royal Scots was in 8th Brigade of 3rd Division.  On Sunday 30th July 1916, 30th Division made a planned attack on the Somme.  Zero hour was 0445hrs.  

Having been in a supporting Brigade in the attack at Montauban on 1st July 1916, 2nd Royal Scots had been heavily engaged in a failed attack on Guillemont on 22nd July 1916.
